bibl.title: Chin Quock Wah vs. Henry M. White. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN QUOCK WAH, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus ) NO. 2971. BAIL BOND.

WHEREAS, CHIN QUOCK WAH, by and through his Attorney, JOHN J. Sullivan, filed an application in the above entitled Court for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, which said Writ was after hearing, discharged by the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, and said petitioner remanded to the custody of the United States Commissioner of Immigration; and

WHEREAS, the said petitioner, CHIN QUOCK WAH, by and through his attorney, JOHN J. SULLIVAN, has appeal from said Order and Judgment entered on the 29 day of May, 1915, to the Supreme Court of the United States; and

WHEREAS, pending said appeal the above entitled Court has required the said petitioner, CHIN QUOCK WAH to be enlarged upon furnishing a Bail Bond in the sum of Two Thousand ($2,000.00) Dollards, with sufficient sureties for the appearance of CHIN QUOCK WAH in the above entitled Court, in case said Decree and Order and Judgment be affirmed.

NOW, THEREFORE, KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That we, CHIN QUOCK WAH, as principal, by and through his Attorney, JOHN J. SULLIVAN, and John P. Hausman and W. R. Colly., J, as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto the United States in the penal sum of Two Thousand ($2,000.00) Dollars, for the payment of which well and truly to be made they bind themselves, their heirs, executors, adminstrators and assigns, jointly and severally, by these presents,
Sealed with their seals and dated this 9 day of June, 1915.

The condition of the above obligation is such that if the above mentioned CHIN QUOCK WAH shall at all times render himself amenable to the orders and processes of the above entitled court, in case said Decree of the above entitled court be affirmed by the Supreme Court of the United States, and will appear for judgment in case it is ultimately determined that the said petitioner is not entitled to a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and is remanded to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, then this obligation to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
div1.ab: Chin Quock Wah BY John J Sullivan Attorney for Petitioner CHIN QUOCK WAH
div1.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING ) SS

John P. Hausman and W. R. Colly. J. being first duly sworn, each for himself deposes and says: That he is one of the parties who executed the foregoing bail bond as surety; that he is worth the sum of F our Thousand ($4,00.00) D ollars over and above all his just debts and liabilities in statutory, separate property situated in King County, State of Washington, not by law exempt from sale on execution; that he is not an attorney or counselor at law, Clerk of the Superior Court, County Clerk, or other City, County or State official.
div1.ab: John P. Hansman W. R. Colly, J.
div1.p: Subsribed and sworn to before me this 8th day of June, 1915.
div1.ab: H. J. Hoskins Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
div1.p: APPROVED 9 day of June, 1915.
APPROVED 9 day of June, 1915.
Not. John P. Hausman Property, 3/5 in S. E. Corner 9th & Charles St stands in name of Hausman Realty Co Lots 31 and N 1/2 of L 34 Cldg, 4 Square Park

Copy of within received and due service of same acknowledged this day of 191
Attorney for
NO. 2971. ORIGINAL
IN THE SUPERIOR U.S. DISTRICT COURT STATE OF WASHINGTON KING COUNTY
IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION. Plaintiff vs. In the Matter of the Application of CHIN QUOCK WAH, for a Writ of Habeas C orpus. Defendant
BAIL BOND
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JUN101915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: 2x
BEELER & SULLIVAN LAWYERS 510-11 WHITE BUILDING SEATTLE, WASH.
